sentences.en: a climate of mistrust and fear
sentences.cn: 充满猜疑和恐惧的氛围

sentences.en: As a very small child she had learned to mistrust adults.
sentences.cn: 她很小的时候就学会了不相信大人。

sentences.en: He began to mistrust and fear for his life.
sentences.cn: 他开始怀疑并且为自己的生命感到担忧.

sentences.en: I tended to mistrust my emotions and intellectualize everything.
sentences.cn: 我往往不相信自己的情感，倾向于把一切事物都理智化。

sentences.en: It's precisely that sort of slick sales - talk that I mistrust.
sentences.cn: 我不相信的正是那种油腔滑调的推销宣传.

sentences.en: Mistrust is axe at the tree of love.
sentences.cn: 怀疑是爱情树下的一把斧头.

sentences.en: On the contrary, mutual mistrust is now rising.
sentences.cn: 相反地, 互相之间的猜忌正在不断上升.

sentences.en: Please don't think I mistrust you, but I would prefer to have our agreement in black and white.
sentences.cn: 请别以为我不相信你们, 不过,我还是认为我们应把协议写成书面形式为好.

sentences.en: The financial cost of this mistrust in e - commerce was approximately US $ 2 bn in 2006.
sentences.cn: 电子商务 中这类不信任的财务成本在2006年大约20亿美元.

sentences.en: The more mistrust we feel, the less confidence we have.
sentences.cn: 多一分对他人的疑虑, 就少一分对自己的信心.

sentences.en: There was mutual mistrust between the two men.
These gentlemen had an indefinable mistrust of her good offices.
sentences.cn: 这些先生们对她的好意殷勤抱有难以名状的戒心.

sentences.en: We mistrust him of having a hand in all that followed.
sentences.cn: 因此我们疑心他和此后发生的事情有关.

sentences.en: We ourselves have learnt to mistrust the concept of income.
sentences.cn: 我们自己已经懂得不相信收入这一概念.

words.tran_cn: 不信任的；深疑的，多疑的

trans.tran_en: the feeling that you cannot trust someone, especially because you think they may treat you unfairly or dishonestly
the feeling that you cannot trust someone, especially because you think they may treat you unfairly or dishonestly
to not trust someone, especially because you think they may treat you unfairly or dishonestly
